intro: Phyllorkis albida, commonly known as the white-flowered rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its white petals are surrounded by a ring of yellow-orange ray florets, creating a striking visual contrast. Phyllorkis albida is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
